title: Charles Smith 2014 King Coal Stoneridge Vineyard Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Syrah, the aromas draw you into the glass, with light notes of savory herb, cassis, pipe tobacco, spice and crushed rock. It brings a flat-out gorgeous sense of texture, covering the palate from end to end with cherry flavors that glide on the finish. The feel is knee-buckling. Best after 2021.

title: HammerSky 2014 The Party Estate Grown Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Merlot and 25% Petit Verdot is all about richness, starting with aromas of vanilla, caramel, milk chocolate, licorice and black-currant crème brûlée. Soft and plush on the palate, the butterscotch, candied blueberry and black plum-syrup flavors are laid across slices of hot spice cake and lifted by mulling spices.

title: Hertelendy 2014 Signature Mountain Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a Merlot-driven blend at 82%, with 12% Cabernet Sauvignon, 4% Malbec and 2% Petit Verdot. The Merlot is from an older site on Howell Mountain. Spicy nutmeg seasons a soft, rounded palate of integrated tannin and full-bodied but balanced weight, the fruit flavor crisp in cherry, raspberry and cassis, just a touch of butterscotch revealed at the wine's end.

title: Birichino 2014 Lilo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: There's a fascinating and lovable rustic quality to this single-vineyard bottling, which is slightly cloudy in the glass and shows aromas of red cherry, hickory smoke, dust and a feral gaminess. That foxy element is prevalent on the sip, with hints of animal hide and dried chaparral set against pomegranate and wild strawberry flavors.

title: Hall 2014 Jack's Masterpiece Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a sturdy, grippy and youthful 100% varietal wine, from vineyards planted in mountainous locations. Bright focused acidity lifts dense flavors of black cherry and sage that are wrapped in spicy, clove-driven oak. Enjoy best from 2024–2034.

title: Hall 2014 The North End Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is an inaugural release, blended with 7% Merlot and aged 22 months in French oak, 65% new. From vines grown predominantly in the northern end of the valley (Calistoga and St. Helena), it features a grainy texture of bold dark cherry that's granular and focused on the palate. Tobacco and leather add to the savory nature of the billowy tannin power. Enjoy best 2020–2030.

title: La Jota Vineyard 2014 Merlot (Howell Mountain)
description: Blended with 10% Petit Verdot, this age-worthy beauty is impressively oaked and tannic in its youth, with a concentration of densely packed red and black currants. Coconut shavings and vanilla appear from the background alongside black pepper and cinnamon. This should drink best from 2024–2034.

title: Prunotto 2014 Bric Turot  (Barbaresco)
description: After some time in the glass the 2014 Bric Turot reveals complex aromas of wild berry, dark spice, blue flower and balsamic notes. The elegantly structured, energized palate is even more expressive than the nose, delivering ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, cinnamon and star anise. It has terrific tension, thanks to vibrant acidity and firm, polished tannins. Open a few hours ahead of time. Drink 2019–2029.

title: Ashes & Diamonds 2014 No. 1 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This new producer offers the first vintage of this wine. Made by Steve Matthiasson in a classically restrained style, it was given plenty of room to develop varietal character, with 25% Merlot adding softness. It shines in a texture of dense black raspberry dotted in black pepper and pencil—its herbaceous character in balance. An underlying freshness keeps it compelling and bright.

title: Heinrich Hartl 2014 Graf Weingartl Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)
description: The aromatic allure of tiny, dark elderberries captures the nose. They also appear on the palate, embraced by vanilla and polished notes of new oak. The structure is firm but the body is sinuous and marked by vivid freshness. Made in an international style, this will integrate over the coming months to present a sumptuous and elegant Pinot Noir.

title: K Vintners 2014 The Creator Powerline Estate Vineyard Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Cabernet Sauvignon (80%) takes the lead on this wine, which includes 20% Syrah. The aromas announce themselves, with appealing notes of green olive, herb, moist earth, stem, smoked meat and mineral. The mix of fruit and savory flavors delights the senses, showing intensity but also deftness.

title: Ken Brown 2014 Rita's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Pioneering winemaker Ken Brown is still making excellent wine 40 years on, including this bottling that's full of deep red cherry, scarlet red rose petals and dark hibiscus on a nose that's veiled by loamy soil and slate. The palate is tightly wound, with crushed herbs, sandy soils, cranberry and fresh purple-flower flavors that sail across the palate into a vanilla-kissed finish.

title: La Pitchoune 2014 Holder Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a bright, acid-driven wine, citrus-laden alongside crisp, tart red fruit and a light-bodied approach to ripeness. The nose is exotic in rose petal and lavender, with streaks of cardamom and cola spice that persist for a long time on the finish.

title: Renwood 2014 Tempranillo (Amador County)
description: A generous influence from new oak barrels works beautifully on this full-bodied spice-saturated and richly concentrated wine. It has everything from subtle cinnamon and cardamom to ripe and lush black cherry notes to a lingering finish that echoes spices and dark fruit. Fine-grained tannins shape the mouthfeel and add welcome grip.

title: Shafer 2014 Relentless Syrah-Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: This perennial powerhouse of a wine is a blend of 89% Syrah and 11% Petite Sirah, aged 30 months in 100% new French oak. It offers a hard-hitting intensity of stewed plum, cherry and buttery vanilla, with thick, structured tannins that are firm and integrated. Meat, black licorice and black pepper combine effortlessly and should shine bright after aging. Enjoy from 2029 and beyond.

title: Sixto 2014 Moxee Chardonnay (Washington)
description: Coming from a vineyard planted in 1973 at an elevation of 1,450 feet, the aromas draw you into the glass, with intoxicating notes of cream, ginger, pumpkin spice and chamomile. The palate possesses a creamy texture but also a sense of weightlessness that provides a lot of appeal. The balance is exquisite.

title: Château de Saint-Cosme 2014  Gigondas
description: Lavish and ripe, this full-figured red offers loads of plump black-cherry and raspberry flavors. It's surprisingly vibrant on the midpalate, framed by fine, delicate tannins and a bracing hint of charcoal on the finish. Lovely already, it's concentrated enough to improve through 2025.

title: Donelan 2014 Cuvée Moriah Red (Sonoma County)
description: This memorable wine blends 84% Grenache from the Dry Stack Vineyard in Bennett Valley with 16% Mourvèdre from the Kopf Vineyard. It's exotic and approachable, offering a rich taste of cherry liqueur and tart pomegranate with a background of soft oak and earthy baking spice.

title: Everhart Cellars 2014 Dorado Canyon Vineyard Malbec (El Dorado)
description: Very ripe and concentrated, this full-bodied wine has powerful fruit flavors, a big impact on the palate and very firm tannins to hold it together. The color is very deep, the aromas are like ripe blackberries dusted with cinnamon and cedar, and the flavors go deep and long, lingering on the finish.

title: K Vintners 2014 Rock Garden Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Coming from The Rocks District, the aromas pop, with notes of flower, raspberry, moist earth, wet gravel, green stem, smoked meat, peat and musk. The palate shimmers with intensity but still shows a lot of restraint, displaying an assortment of fruit and savory flavors that persist on the finish.

title: Lapostolle 2014 Cuvée Alexandre Viñedo Apalta Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: This lusty Cabernet is earthy, jammy and warm on the nose. In the mouth, this is broad and massive, with an undercurrent of firm tannins that provide structure. Deep dark flavors of blackberry, plum and fig finish with strength on a fruit-packed finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Sixto 2014 Uncovered Chardonnay (Washington)
description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Frenchman Hills (33%), Moxee (28%), Roza Hills (27%) and Evergreen vineyards. The aromas show a lot of subtlety, with notes of candied ginger, lemon curd, spice, peach, cream, toast, wet stone and pineapple, revealing more on each swirl. The palate is rich but refined, showing precision and detail along with a real sense of freshness. The finish impresses. Beautiful stuff.

title: B. Leighton 2014 Olsen Brothers Petit Verdot (Yakima Valley)
description: This variety is making waves in Washington and this wine demonstrates why. The aromas are effusive, with notes of dark cherry, dried herb and barrel spice. The palate is filled to the brim with rich fruit flavors that show focus and depth, while the tannins are combed to a fine sheen. It's high on the hedonist scale—a standout offering.

title: Isole e Olena 2014  Chianti Classico
description: Fragrant and refined, this radiant red opens with enticing scents of wild berry, aromatic herb, dark spice, menthol and whiffs of tilled soil and pressed blue flower. Ethereally elegant and boasting great tension, the palate delivers succulent red cherry, raspberry, clove and a hint of licorice while vibrant acidity and polished, fine-grained tannins lend balance and support. Drink through 2024.

title: K Vintners 2014 El Jefe Stoneridge Vineyard Tempranillo (Washington)
description: The aromas are sweet and sappy, with notes of raspberry, herb, pipe tobacco and musk. The palate shows more restraint than the aromas might suggest, bringing a suave sense that carries through a finish that just won't quit. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery, bringing a lot of richness.

title: La Jota Vineyard 2014 Cabernet Franc (Howell Mountain)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine, juicy and broad on the palate with mouth-filling tannins that show its youthful vigor. Cherry and raspberry liqueur flavors run deep, wrapped in sizable oak and well-integrated accents of cedar and dried herb. This stands to be cellared; enjoy best 2024 through 2029.

title: Laurence Féraud 2014 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Savory tones of tobacco leaf, dried lavender and thyme lend a dark, sultry appeal to rich blackberry and plum here. This wine is fleshy on the palate yet firmly balanced with fine, taut tannins and a lingering, brambly finish. Graceful and nuanced, it should drink at prime through 2030.

title: Sixto 2014 Frenchman Hills Chardonnay (Washington)
description: Of the vineyard designated wines, this one comes from the youngest vines, planted in 1998. The aromas of peach, pear, mineral, pineapple upside down cake and spice are subtle and refined. The palate is sleek yet silky and extremely flavorful, full of stone-fruit flavors that lead to a finish that won't quit. It's all about delicacy and restraint, hitting a lot of high notes.

title: Cutruzzola 2014 Gloria Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: The nose on this bottling is both juicy and serious, with cherry, pomegranate, dewy morning sagebrush, muddy sand and star anise aromas. There is solid textural tension to the sip, where red currant and lavender flavors mesh. Strong acidity soars into the finish.

title: Furthermore 2014 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This winery is packaging the freshness and restraint that's possible in this region, with this bottling offering aromas of pomegranate, red currant and star anise on the nose. The palate is vibrant with red fruit, yet it is the bay leaf, wild mint and fennel pollen flavors that impress most and carry deep into the finish.
